Package matchle

Class MatchleGame

java.lang.Object
matchle.MatchleGame
public class MatchleGame extends Object
The main console implementation of the Matchle word guessing game. This class manages the game flow, user interaction through console, and integrates with the GameLogic for core game functionality. The game involves guessing a secret word by making a series of guesses, with feedback provided after each guess to narrow down the possibilities.

  • Constructor Details

    • MatchleGame

      public MatchleGame()
      Constructs a new Matchle game with default settings. Initializes the game logic component.

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Entry point for running the game from the command line. Creates and starts a new Matchle game.
      Parameters:
      args - Command line arguments (not used)

    • playGame

      public void playGame()
      Public method to start the game. Initializes the game state and begins the game loop.

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the game by loading the corpus and setting up the game logic. This method should be called before starting a game.

    • updateGameState

      public void updateGameState(NGram guess)
      Updates the game state based on a new guess. Processes the guess, generates a filter, and updates the candidate corpus.
      Parameters:
      guess - The guess used to update the game state

    • checkGameTermination

      public boolean checkGameTermination()
      Checks if the game has terminated by testing various ending conditions.
      Returns:
      true if the game has ended, false otherwise

    • handleSingleCandidate

      public boolean handleSingleCandidate()
      Handles the case when only one candidate word remains. Checks if this candidate matches the secret key and outputs appropriate messages.
      Returns:
      true if there is only one candidate remaining, false otherwise

    • handleEmptyCorpus

      public boolean handleEmptyCorpus()
      Handles the case when no candidate words remain. Outputs a message with the secret key.
      Returns:
      true if no candidates remain, false otherwise

    • getAccumulatedFilter

      public Filter getAccumulatedFilter()
      Gets the accumulated filter from all rounds played so far.
      Returns:
      The accumulated Filter object

    • getCandidateCorpus

      public Corpus getCandidateCorpus()
      Gets the current candidate corpus containing all possible words that match the accumulated filter.
      Returns:
      The Corpus of candidate words

    • getInitialCorpus

      public Corpus getInitialCorpus()
      Gets the initial corpus of words before any filtering.
      Returns:
      The initial Corpus

    • getBestGuess

      public NGram getBestGuess()
      Gets the best guess based on the current game state.
      Returns:
      The NGram representing the best guess

    • getSecretKey

      public NGram getSecretKey()
      Gets the secret key that players are trying to guess.
      Returns:
      The NGram representing the secret key
